intro: Elaphoglossum jinoteganum, commonly known as the Jinotega holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leathery fronds with a distinctive, serrated margin. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are arranged in a linear pattern along the undersides of the leaves. This fern is native to Central America, particularly in the region of Jinotega in Nicaragua.
